column2: Pam, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I am 62 been on this 10 year. I suffered terrible night sweats, didn't sleep and headaches that went on for weeks, and was always irritable. All these symptoms completely went away after a month. My question is when do I ever go off? My internist said I should go off my GYNO said no problem you can stay on them as long as you're having no problem. Do I stay on these till I die???

column2: Deb, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Been on for 3 weeks, and am miserable.  Night sweats are still awful, and now I am sleeping even worse because of anxiety.  Nausea is horrible, and have lost weight. So nervous, and feel so much worse. Have gone off today.

column1: Vaginal Inflammation due to Loss of Hormone Stimulation
column2: carol,  Female  (Patient)
column9: I have vaginal spotting, and vaginal cramping, almost like having a period. I am 57 years old- not ready to take on the cramps of menses. Will consult with my gyno on this.

column2: itsme2258, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: The risks of breast cancer were not fully explained. I have been diagnosed with breast cancer and the only thing I have to indicate any risk is taking estrogen. There is no history in my family, however there was ovarian cancer. I should have never been prescribed this drug.

column2: bulby, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: feel sick increased headaches. weight gain and bloat.

column2: pbjmorrison, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have taken this drug for probably close to 10 years. For the last few months began not feeling well. Lots of anxiety and some minor hot flashes at night. Went into dr for anxiety and had blood test done showing my body was no longer absorbing the estrogen. My level were as low as without any hormone treatment. Just curious if anyone else has experienced this.

column2: I forgot, 55-64 on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I took this drug for 5 yrs. I wasn't certain I still needed it, so I stopped for a while. WRONG!! The hot flashes and night sweats returned with a vengence! Went back on the meds. Then, the insurance co. insisted on the generic instead. OMG! What a difference! Moody, depressed and miserable! Now I have no meds and again experiencing the hot flashes and night sweats! I'm 63. Took various HRTs for 15 yrs. Will this EVER be over?

column2: one hot momma, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on this medication for one week with little to no improvements to my hot flashes. The night sweats actually seem to be worse. I am just wondering how long it takes for this medication to "kick in". Will continue for another week but if no improvement will call Doctor.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I'M 54 AND IN FULL BLOWN MENOPAUSE..I WENT 6 MONTHS WITHOUT ANYTHING AND HAD TO GO ON THIS BECAUSE OF TERRIBLE HOT FLASHES..THIS MEDICATION HAS REALLY HELPED..THE ONLY PROBLEM IS THE EXPENSE..I'M ON A GENERIC FORM BUT IT IS STILL $50 CO-PAY!!! I GUESS THAT'S NOT A BAD TRADE OFF TO GET RID OF THE HOT FLASHES

column2: dee2242, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking this after the Combi Patch made me bleed for 3 months. I relieved all my hot flashes and night sweats but after taking it for 3 weeks, I noticed heartburn and a VERY bad Ingestion. Also, I got a aching pain under my ribcage. I stopped taking this medicine asap. Side efffects were awful.

column2: elleshabai, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I ran out of my prescription and have been off this for over a week.  The last 9 months I have been very moody and irritated.  Quick to anger specifically to my husband.  The last week I have been so calm and loving.  I feel like myself again.  I am in the beginning stages of menopause, maybe 1-2 periods a year at the most.  My doctor decided I needed to be on this at the beginning of the year when I went for my annual check up.I have been wondering why I am so quick to get mad and my emotions have been all over the charts.  Being off this for a week has been an awakening and a gift from God.  I am doing just fine, better than I have all year.  I never even had symptoms of menopause other than missing some periods.I think doctor's just put us on things and we just accept that we need it because they prescribe it.  I'm off this for good and my husband couldn't be happier.  It's remarkable the difference in my personality without this drug in my system.  I honestly couldn't figure out the change in my personality and now I know.  Drugs change you and not always for the better!

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: i have used this drug for 10 + years with no problems. I do have some minor ovarian pain and am now curious if it is related to the activella use

column2: Ruth, 3-6 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Easy to use. Certainly addressed the night sweats and hot flashes. But I have had almost non-stop bleeding and breast tenderness.

column2: ROUCHON, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: THIS TREATMENT WORKED WELL WITH ME.

column2: cooler, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: have been in menopause for 4 years-doctor says-hot flashes for many more years, some night sweats.  Started Activella 5 months ago and hot flashes were better after 2 months-now only minor.  Didn't think had side effects until reading others-but have had bloating.  Now have had light period for the last 2 months-only a few days but..first time in 4 years!  Had a D&C 20 months ago to remove 3 small cysts(before Activella)so not sure if the bleeding is med related or cysts again.  Making doctor appointment Monday.  My insurance company changed me to the generic form in June w/o me realizing it.  Symptoms came back-fast!  When I asked the pharmacy what could be wrong, they told me about the change.  My doctor made the call and I'm back on the original Activella.  It only took 2 weeks on it this time and symptoms were better.  Now if bleeding is NOT related to Activella-I'll keep taking it, but if it is..I lived with the hot flashes for years, hated them, but at least I will live.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this med for 8 days now because of hot flashes and night sweats.  So far not relief and seems night sweats are worse.  I will give it a full month try before I make a decision to continue.

column2: Creston, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I went off YAZ low dose birth control (took for low iron issues and it greatly helped) due to monthly 3 day headaches.  I'm 47 and went into hot flashing, so Dr. put me on Activella. Experienced immediate relief, and feel more calm...like my nerves have been coated with oil. NICE.  But have scalp acne now, losing hair, and may be getting headaches again.  Also, losing my grip and dropping things ALOT - dropped a coffee cup just walking down the hallway.  Anyone else having this symptom? I fear going off it due to the irritability, nervousness, and hot flashing symptoms returning, BUT what is this stuff really doing to my BRAIN ??

column2: chris, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: ever since I started taking these I have had headaches and have no energy plus am very emotional, will be getting off them real soon.

column2: NAWNEE4, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: HOT FLASHES SOOO MUCH BETTER ALMOST ALL GONE, OAB TOTALLY GONE, MOOD MUCH BETTER, EVEN WITH THE RISK I DECIDED QUALITY OF LIFE IS WORTH IT!!

column2: Diane, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: My ob/gyn let me go straight from a low dose of the pill (which I had been on since 40 due to perimenopause sysmptoms) to Activella 9 months ago.  First thing I noticed was hair loss, lucky I have a thick full head of hair.  Scared me but it subsided after a couple of months. Sleeping didn't really improve and hot flashes are minimal.  Great libido my entire life has virtually disappeared.  Last 3/4 months I have been having a lot of joint pain and have definately gained at least 10/15 lbs.  I've always had an hourglass shape and now I feel thick and bloated thru the middle.  I'm considering going off to see what happens just want to make sure I do it the right way, and if I feel worse can I go back on.  I don't want to yo/yo but I'll have to wait and see. Actually, I felt better and thinner on the low dose pill but those days are over. I may look into herbal remedies if needed.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: THE HRT ACTAVELA HAS WORKED VERY WELL FOR ME, HOWEVER, GETTING THE PILLS OUT OF THAT PACKAGE IS ALMOST IMPOSSIBLE.  OTHERWISE, I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT.

column2: oliveoyle42004, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am very satisfied with Activella Oral,before use I had terrible hotflashes,night sweats.Now I may have one hotflash a day!and the night sweats are gone.I am very satisvied.

column2: Indymom, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I'm 48 yrs. old and was told I had entered meno at 38. Symptoms didn't really start till age 43. Dealt with everything for as long as possible, but the last 6 months have been hell. I've always had baby fine hair and have been "shedding" off/on for awhile. This was a major concern that I shared with my dr. She put me on activella. At first I thought it was great, stopped immediately with hit flashes, helped panic attacks. By week 2 had severe sinus infection, have had back pain. By week 6-7 started having severe anger issues, not even a short fuse! By week 8 I'm ticked at the world and losing a ton of hair!! I called my dr. and explained my symptoms but didn't get a call back. I'm also having eye problems and depression. I'm stopping immediately and not trying any form of hrt. These symptoms are no better than menopause. I pray what hair I have left still stays put and what I've lost comes back. I do not recommend, if you couldn't figure it out...

column2: karen, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took this drug or 20 to 25 days.  the night sweats stopped but I gained additional dfficulties which included:  irritablitiy, extreme cramping during ovulation (which started back up) , extreme back cramps, unknown bruises in my lower leg appeared, gained weight.  I stopped and went to a nature store and begain taking a natural supplement and it is working well.

column2: Mustang1, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After 3 weeks on Activella, I am so depressed I can hardly function; plus my skin itches in various places at random times. I tried the prempro first and it affected me the same way. I stopped taking this yesterday.

column2: karen, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took this 4 days short of a month.  In the first week I became paranoid, fearful and felt very lonesome.  I quit taking it!

column2: uncadiane, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have only been on the med for 5 days.  The hot flashes have reduced, but mentally I am irritable, agitated, feeling fogged; plus I had a bad headache that last all day on the second day of treatment.  I'm going to stop and see if these things disappear.

column2: lor12, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Gained 10 pounds in three weeks and in the first week was fine then began having extreme hot flashes, headaches, and nervousness. Stopped today and hoping I will regulate back to what was normal for me before the HRT.

column2: 55-64 Female  (Patient)
column9: I began treatment 6 weeks ago for hot flashes, brain fog/confusion,and lack of sleep. I'm noticing positive changes in all areas.  I feel much better!

column2: barbi, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Taking this for 'brain fog,' and it has helped quite a bit.  One month in, I have bad chronic lower back pain and leg pain, which are listed as side effects. I'm going to try 1 more month to see if the pain subsides. I am also doing excercises and stretches for my back. If the pain is not better a month from now, I'll talk to my doctor about stopping or switching medication.

column2: kountrythyme, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've been on this for about 2 weeks, I have not really had a bad time with hot sweats but the mood swings and ravenous appetite is awful..also the libdo is GONE. So far the Activella has helped a bit, the mood swings are still there...I'm hoping it's just the holiday thing. Otherwise I'm doing fine, no side effects...fingers crossed!

column2: jhubbert, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was fine for about 4-6 weeks then started noticing little annoying thing like breakthrough bleeding, head aches, sleep disturbances. The side effects worsened, increased in number abruptly to the point I had to call an ambulance. I thought I was having a heart attack. I quit taking them and I feel fine. I'm expecting the hot flashes to start and the dryness to be a problem again- but I'll deal with it naturally. Better to be around with menopausal symptoms than not be around at all. HRT's are definately off my list.

column2: happierforachange, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been on this for 6 months and it's been very helpful! I thought I was losing my mind and it was very scary before taking this. Within a few days I could see the difference. The hot flashes and migraines are gone. Memory is getting better and foggy brain is much better. Vaginal dryness and alot of breast tenderness, painful actually. I feel anxious but not sure that is the med. Libido is down quite a bit but it beats feeling crazy. I don't think I could live without this.

column2: jls , 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on Activella for 8 yrs and have never had any side effects.  It has been a wonderful change in my life.  I had hot flashes for 3 wks and couldn't sleep at night, hot cold hot cold on and on and on until I took this drug for 3 days and I was a new person.  I have tried to wean but still have hot flashes so will continue.  Migraines were reduced as well.  I will begin my 9th yr on this drug.  I do not take the generic only the real thing.  My dr. told me too many problems with the generic.

column2: JVilla, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was having hot flashes at least 20+ times daily. I noticed a difference within a couple of days....What a miracle! They only side effects I have are breast tenderness prett much all the time and it has made me start having "periods" monthly. I would rather deal with these side effects than deal with those horrible hot flashes!! Thank you Activella!!!!!

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I went from having 15 to 20 hot flashes a day to none in just 3 weeks.  I love it!!!

column1: Wasting of Tissues of the Vulva
column2: lesllou5, 45-54 on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Activella has changed the quality of life for the better...No more hot flashes and hormonal pms.. however unfortunatley  it has not effected my vaginal atrophy situation so i take Vagifem in addition.

column2: Tina W., 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Immediately after starting Activella (generic version) I could feel the difference - hot flashes were fewer, night sweats not as bad, sleeping better.  I've been on it 5 weeks now and all of my early-onset menopause symptoms are gone.  It's wonderful to not have hot flashes any longer (25+ at the worst) and to sleep soundly through the night again.  My only complaint is that about a week ago I noticed fairly painful breast tenderness.  However, this is tolerable compared to how I felt prior to the medication.  And, as at least one other person has already commented, I did have nighttime nausea for the first 2-3 weeks.  Again, tolerable, especially compared to the alternative.

column2: LaurieB, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just started taking this medication.  My hot flashes are definitely better, but I have noticed my urine is cola colored and has a very strong smell.  Is this normal?  Called doc and he said it is the hormones going through my system and if it continues after a month, to call him again.  A month?  Has anyone else has this problem?

column2: cind, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am so grateful that the nurse in my doctor's office recommended I try this medication.  I had been having 15-20 very uncomfortable hot flashes a day for 8 years.  I had previously tried Prempro to alleviate the hot flashes, but it made me violently sick.  Activella has worked wonders so far(after 3 weeks of taking the medication)no hot flashes even with the 90+ degree weather!  The only side effect that I have experienced was a very slight bit of nausea in the evening during the first week of taking Activella.  That has since ended, and I am very happy with the results of taking this med.

column2: lou, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: on activella for 10 years.no night sweats or hot flashes. Now I have night sweats and hot flashes,not working as well. I have pain in my left arm when i exercise with weights,hope no side effects

column2: Jamie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This is day four taking low dose generic for Activella. I am having calf pain in my right leg when I sit down. I smoke and asked my Dr. if I could and he said it would not be a problem. I am beginning to wonder if I should be on this.

column2: sizzlers, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Helped with hot flashes within 3 days, after 3 months some bloating, weight gain, and extremely swollen and tender breasts.  Never had any other problems except hot flashes which the drug worked fine.  Did not improve libido.

column2: Dana419, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: prescribed for excessive bleeding, first month was ok and now almost 3 months in still having excessive bleeding, dizziness, and have gained 15 pounds. I wasn't having hot flashes but now I have them all the time.

column2: Corinne, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I had been on Activella for many years with great results until now.  I have been diagnosed with breast cancer and my Medical Oncologist said it was not genetic but caused by the HRT.  It is "fueled" by the estrogen.  I know there are debates onwhether or not HRT causes breast cancer but I for one am a believer.

column2: brokenwing, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was placed on Activella today by my doctor so I cannot comment yet on the medication.  I see by  the posts there appear to be more favorable reviews than non-favorable so I am praying this helps me with hot flashes, depression, irritability and just the over all change of life symptoms. Some days I feel like I am going nuts!

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: this treatment is awsome.  I love drugs.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: At first it seemed to work for my menepause symptoms but it does not sem to be working for the hot flashes, night sweats and lack of sleep anymore. I hate this.

column2: bmbmom, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was on Prempro for 4 months w/no success. GYN placed me on Activella 1.0/.5 two months ago. No more hot flashes. No more night sweats. Side effects minimal for the benefits. Just a little breast tenderness.

column2: clearwater , 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Have taken 1/.5mg dosage for about a month due to surgical menopause.  its helping with the emotional rollercoster and no more hot flashes. No side effects as far as I can tell.

column2: (Patient)
shrimp, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have just been taking it for 3 weeks but I am less irritable, and I dont feel like crying all the time.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
mmk, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Here we go again.  Have tried Activella (lowest dose) for a month to relieve night sweats and hot flashes.  Got almost instantaneous relief from these symptoms and got a period within a week which has not stopped 3 weeks later.  I do not want to put up with this. Also have slightly tender swollen breasts and bloat/weight gain which are somewhat tolerable.  I had the same problem 2 yrs ago with Prempro,  thought it was wonderful at first then as the side-effects kicked in and worsened, put up with them until it became unbearable, went back to Nuvaring, changed insurance and it became big $$ for the ring, so used Black Cohosh for about 8 months before it stopped working.  I was interested to read that someone else had foot swelling - I believe I may have that also and I am shedding hair like a labrador.  I am so frustrated by the side-effects of these medications.  At this point, I will go back to Black Cohosh and try to put up with the sweats if they return or spend the $ on the ring.

column2: KB, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Symptoms of menopause curtailed, such as hot flashes, night sweats, dryness, etc. as others have noted. Mentally, emotionally = greatest impact on quality of life. Increased my energy, mental state, ability to concentrate and focus, giving me more energy, too.  A big difference.  Highly recommend.  No downside for me.  I am 54 and have taken 3 years.

column2: Joan, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: This has nbeen great for me and mI have been on it for 15 years, since it first came mon the market.

column2: lore52, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: i have been taking the lowest dose of this medication for over 2 years has helped me tremondously with all symptoms, on occassion breast tenderness, just recently having some symptoms return not as severe as initially, waiting on call from dr. to see if it should be increased....never want to feel unglued as i did prior to taking this medication.

column2: sueirvine, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Activella gave me back my life, couldn't sleep totally miserable, BUT, I have been on it just a year and I have a MENINGIOMA, a benign slow growing brain tumor, unfortunately there is a link between hormones and meningiomas. Be Careful!! I am now in the throws of horrible menopause symptoms again. Plus I have an inoperable tumor. I wish I could continue but I don't dare.

column2: Ann, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Activella for about 6 years.  It has been extremely effective relieving joing pain, headaches due to neck pain, sleeping issues, and levels of energy.  Because I am turning 60, my doctor is asking me to reduce from 1.0/.5 to .5/.1  However, after doing this for six months, I am experiencing rapid hair loss, weight loss, headaches, and depression.

column2: suz, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Have been on Activella for about 9 years now and love it. No side effects. No hot flashes, although I stopped taking it for a month after I turned 65 (thought I wouldn't need it any more), but started having hot flashes again, so . . . back on it. Would never want to go back to having those hot flashes again! Heart's good, weight's fine, no bloating, sex drive is good (i'm 66 now!).

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on Activella for about 2 weeks. I put up with hot flashes and waking up every night for about 8 years and decided there must be something to help. It has cut the hot flashes out from 25 a day to about 3 or 4. I notice breast tenderness. I don't think I have been it long enough to see other side effects.

column2: Jane, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've been on this for 6wks and it's  greatly reduced the hot flashes and night sweats...I was waking up mutiple time a night. However, I've now gained 10lbs and feel extremely bloated combine that with a vision changes has made me miserable! I've left word with my Dr. but if I have to choose I'll deal with the hot flashes back!

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I experienced being very bloated, no longer having frequent hot flashes, but a few warm flashes daily, weight gain, blurry vision and just not feeling up to par.  I am now trying over-the-counter Estroven to see if it works better.

column2: snowflake,  Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on Activella for 2 months. My hot flashes have stopped, I am sleeping better, and my mind is sharper. I suffered with symptoms for 4 years. What a relief to feel normal again.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: just started 2days ago,sleeping much better and feel like i have energy that i havent had in a long time.worried about side effects,none yet.will try to complete 20day sample to mk decision whether to continue.

column2: Vango, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Activella for 7 years now. I take the 1mg/0.5mg. So far I'm doing good with this. They came out with a generic, and it mad me feel like I was ready to go nuts. So I'm going back to the brand due to side effects. I'd rather pay more for the brand Activella, than have horrible side effects from the generic.

column2: rocki1, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After watching Oprah and Suzanne Sommers discuss bioidentical HRT, I tried to get into my Ob/gyn for a consultation -- I'd been experiencing anxiety for 2 two years (!!), but tried to gut it out thinking I could get through using soy, black cohash, etc.  I finally couldn't stand it anymore because I wasn't getting any sleep at night either.  After research decided not to go the compounding pharmacy route, and was put on activella.  After 3 days woke up and didn't have any anxiety!  OMG I had forgotten what "normal" felt like!  No more migraines either -- after several years!  Jeez, why didn't my female doc tell me about this earlier!!  Just upset that my quality of life suffered for prob 5 years, but I JUST DIDN'T KNOW IT WAS MENOPAUSAL ONSET.  I love these hormones!!

column2: dbeigh, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I began a course of Activella two months ago, when notified that my insurance company would no longer pay for PremPro. After two months, I was having several hot flashes a day, night sweats, and depressed, PMS-like symptons. I will gladly pay the full freight for PremPro, on which I had NONE of these symptoms, if the insurance company will not relent.

column2: Trainer, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on this medication for several years and it has worked extremely well for me -- no side effects at all.  Before I went on it, my main problems were joint pain and just feeling "old."  I noticed a difference almost immediately.

column2: oshngrl, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I want to warn women that Acivella can be a very dangerous drug. I took it for 2 months and developed severely increased allergies, flu symptoms, asthma and the feeling that I was being strangled and suffocated. I also have fibromyalgia that became much more painful. Be very very careful with this drug.

column2: Cyster, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After taking it for 2 days, I developed a large red welt and lump on my breast. Had an ultrasound and it turned out to be a cyst. Is this common? I am now on an antibiotic to treat the cyst. Very frightening as I feared inflammatory breast cancer. Still hoping it will stop my night sweating.

column2: dolphin, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: My Gyn recommended .5 mg after the warnings came out abt HRT. I had taken a stronger dose. This works well. Some breast tenderness but that is about the only side effect. I tried going off it for 6 mos but am back on it again. WHY HAS RESEARCH NOT FOUND RELIEF for all the women who experience so many problems with menopause? There is no excuse. HELP US! It is 2009. We should certainly have more substantial info on dealing with menopausal symptoms. It's not as if this is a recent revelation!

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: My doc choses this med for my severe hot flashes and night sweats. It did relieve those, but I developed bloating, back pain, pelvic pain and spotting. I had to have a uterine biopsy which showed "abnormal cells". I went off this med and had another painful uterine biopsy which was then normal. I was suffering terribly from the sudden withdrawal of estrogen. Then I started doing alot of research and discovered bioidentical hormone replacement (estrogen patch plus progesterone). I am like a NEW woman now. I feel wonderful.

column2: rodeomom,  Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: so far, so good.  been on .5mg for a week and can tell a big diffence - no more night sweats - less brain fog and feel more energetic - better than I have felt in about 18 months.  only side effect so far is breast tenderness.  Go back to dr, in 90 days.

column2: legacy, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: My gyn is resistant to any HRT. This is better than nothing, but I felt better on Prempro 4.5. She is paranoid about the breast cancer risk. I don't consider being a miserable person with healthy breasts a fair compromise, so I insist on at least a low dose of HRT. Quality of life issue for me. I experienced vaginal dryness with Activella, so she added Vagifem. I dislike using those tablets and intend to try the ring.

column2: Bellataxi, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Starting taking it to relieve hot flashes and severe mood swings. Felt great first two months, then started experiencing severe muscle and joint pain with occular migraines. Went off about 2 weeks ago and now having allergic reaction to something. Breaking out in hives. Don't know for sure if its the Activella, but it is a stated side effect. Weird happening after I quit taking it. No more HRT for this girl.

column2: barb, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i have breast tenderness, bloating,and spotting,also i weight more. this is my 3rd. month using it...

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
65-74 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: First two weeks...Great!  No hot flashes, no night sweats, sleeping through the night.  Then, 31 days of heavy bleeding started, ankles and feet started swelling, weakness and shortness of breath followed.  Had to go off and have no intention of ever trying again.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on .5mg for almost 3 months now.  Vaginal dryness has decreased.  I am sleeping better and have an occasional hot flash.  My breast are very tender and some mild uterine discomfort.  But havent had any break through bleeding.

column2: ???, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been taking 1.5 mg for 3 months now, with constant spotting between heavy monthly periods. Now I notice my hair is falling out. I suppose my bones are stronger.I'm wondering how to go off this drug? How much worse does it get if you stop taking it?

column2: LadyAce, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Started Activella early in menopause and have had NO adverse symptoms.However, experiencing drop in libido, and my husband and I are both upset about it.  But sex is great once he "warms me up"!  Anyone else experience libido problems?  Doctor says that has nothing to do with menopause/HRT but things I read online seem to differ.

column2: Deb, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have taken Activella for 3 months. I drive alot about 180 miles every 2 weeks. I've noticed that it has made me very nervous when I drive a distance and also it makes my vision somewhat blurred. Had to stop taking it.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I JUST STARTED TAKING THIS 2 WEEKS AGO AND I HAVE NOTICED SOME IMPROVEMENT.  THE HOT FLASHES AREN'T AS BAD, THE NIGHT SWEATS HAVE LESSENED,I'M NOT AS FORGETFUL SO FAR SO GOOD MAYBE A STRONGER DOSE?? I'M ON THE 0.5 AND I WILL BE WAITING 2 MORE WEEKS TO SEE HOW THIS WILL GO BEFORE CONSULTING WITH MY DOCTOR TO UP THE DOES, OVERALL IT HAS BEEN A GODSEND.

column2: sentra57, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: My night sweats dissappeared but so did my sex drive. I smoke and never thought much about the smoking warnings associated with this drug. Please stop smoking if you are taking this drug. I had an ekg in july of 2007 about 4 months after starting this drug and My heart was fine other than the mumer I'd had for years. One year later and still smoking but 1 month after stopping my Activella.05mg daily dose I find out I have heart disease. My heart is enlarged on one side and I have a severe aneurysm that is going to need surgery, one valve is leaking and my heart is having a hard time pushing the blood out to the rest of my body.  All this damage in ONE YEAR!!

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been very leery about taking a HR, but couldn't deal with waking up 6x per night and the emotional highs and lows.  Honestly after the 1st night I felt a difference.  After 3-4 nights no more hot flashes (day or night).  My breast are tender, and there is slight vaginal discomfort, but the trade off is huge.  Just a little nervous enough to keep researching possible side effects on a regular basis

column2: Rebecca,  Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been satisified with activella but have been told recently by my doctor that my pap smear came back bad and that I should discontinue activella because it could contributing to the possibility of cancer.  I guess my question to you is, can it be a factor or not?

column2: schmidL, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Been on this medication for about a month a half.  I was a mess prior to taking it - crying, night sweats and unable to sleep.  The night sweats are completely gone.  Still a little moodiness, but very managable.  Still having trouble sleeping through the night.  Wake at 3 every morning and having trouble falling back asleep.  Even with the sleep problem still being an issue, I've been happy with how the medication has worked for me.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years
column9: Activella has really worked well for me.No bad side affects and stops my hot flashes.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: It's been four years now on a low dosage of Activella. Within one week of starting all symptoms stopped- hot flashes ; crying; irritability and the constant headaches. I was 45 when I started.Tried to go off on two occasions.....all symptoms came back within 2 weeks.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Felt great the first 3 weeks, hot flashes went away, slept better, sex drive up, and lots of vaginal lubrication.  Got a severe yeast infection, then the awful PMS came back.  Hadn't had a period in 6 months, then bled for 11 days and felt horrible.  No energy, abdominal and back pain, bloating and cramping, depression and crying.  Then I noticed the main reason I will no longer use this drug, my hair is falling out on top of my head.  That is also one of the side effects. Now I just have to figure out if I can just stop taking it or should I wean myself off?

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I don't feel like it is helping with much.  I still cry like  a river is running out my eyes.  I'm a bitch from hell,and i feel like crap.I have tried all over the net to see what the instructions are on taking activella.my pharmacist won't enlighten me, says he has to research it...   I know the Dr. gave me instructions but I can't focus long enough to remember them.

column2: smthbrbr3,  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: this medication worked very well for me and my menopause symtoms, especially hot flashes and vaginal dryness.

column2: Sangestein, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Within a week, saw improvements in sleep, vaginal lubrication, and energy.  After one year, memory improved.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
Susie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Worked for me within a week.  Would give up a meal before giving up Activella.  No more hot flashes, night sweats and irritability.  I sleep much better.

column2: SELECTIVENAN, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: THIS MEDICATION TOOK ABOUT 2MONTHS BEFORE I SAW RESULTS  NO MORE VIGINAL DRYNESS AND MY SEX DRIVE IS UP

column2: cool cutie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years
column9: I had some breakthrough bleeding with 1 whole pill per day, but have done well with 1/2 tab per day.  No hot flashes and no vaginal dryness problems

column2: mountaingirl4995379@yahoo.com, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver)
column9: Overall i have had not too many problems. i am on a low dosage of 0.5mg..but the last few months i have been bleeding each month for about 6 days, pretty heavy and then i stop..when that occurs my breat are very, very tender..that is the only side effect i have..i was told to stop the activella then go back on when i stop bleeding...

column2: bodhicitta, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I started out taking Prempro and was experiencing various side effects from that particular drug.  Activella has been a very acceptable alternative.  I had experienced severe hot flashes, mood swings and vaginal dryness.  I feel mostly normal now.

column2: old hottie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: usually after 6 wks x 3 of antidepressants to help control hot flashes didn't work I was ready to take HRT.  This med has been great for the hot flashes, but now I am having a period again, and that stinks!
This drug worked well but some times inconsistently.
